abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Structural Adjustment Credit (SAL I)
            for Mali. The project was intended to support the
            government's adjustment efforts in two key areas of the
            second year Policy Framework Paper (PFP): (i) improving the
            economic incentive system; and (ii) improving public
            resources management. Measures to improve the economic
            incentive system included:( i) simplificationan d
            rationalizatioonf foreign trade taxation; (ii) restructuring
            of indirect and direct taxation; and (iii) removal of
            regulatory constraints inhibiting private sector
            development. Bank's performance was satisfactory.
            Borrower's performance was satisfactory. The key
            lessons learned were as follows: (i) it was unrealistict o
            hope to achieves ustainable overall growth of the economy in
            the face of deteriorating terms of trade without a
            substantial depreciation of the real exchange rate; (ii) a
            longer term institutionald evelopmentp roject, in which
            other donors participate, could be a better instrument han a
            Technical Assistance (TA) component     that accompanies a
            SAL; (iii) the extentt o which a countryh as met the general
            tranche release criterion of maintaining an appropriate
            macroeconomic framework may be difficult to evaluate
            objectively; and (iv) while it is appropriate to set
            quantitative targets for budget allocations to specific
            sectors, budget execution could differ significantly from
            budget allocations and, although the sectoral target may be
            met globally,the intrasectoral patterns may be inconsistent
            with desired sector development and efficiency objectives.
